title: Miktoken*
author: Miktoken*
content: Lost fan errorI have tried to change the 4 original fans of the s17 pro by noctua 3000 rpm fans but it puts me in error, the asic doesn't start, but the fans are running. I have rebooted, reset, put back the Os (hiveon) but nothing. I put the old fans back in and still the same problem. I don't know if it's important but I'd made sure to put them in the same place.thanks

comments.author: danieleither
comments.body: Quote from: Miktoken* on February 25, 2023, 03:33:34 PMLost fan errorI have tried to change the 4 original fans of the s17 pro by noctua 3000 rpm fans but it puts me in error, the asic doesn't start, but the fans are running. I have rebooted, reset, put back the Os (hiveon) but nothing. I put the old fans back in and still the same problem. I don't know if it's important but I'd made sure to put them in the same place.thanks Â  Please post your full kernel log (or at least the last 100 lines or so) so we can see exactly what is going on. Incidently, Bitmain fans usually spin up to 6000RPM, so these may not be a suitable replacement.I've had several compatibility issues with 17-series miners and fans (even using fans purchased directly from Bitmain). I found that I had to use custom firmware that forces 100% fan speeds to get them hashing...

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Before you get copy and paste the kernel logs here make sure that you flash your unit with stock firmware. I don't have experience using Hiveon OS I usually use this OS only for GPU mining.Also, check the fan terminals and plug maybe it has some dirt and is full of rust try to clean it with any motherboard cleaner like Lacquer flo thinner/lighter fluid. If you have a multimeter better check terminals if it's shorted or has no resistance.

comments.author: Miktoken*
comments.body: I'll try to clean up and double check everything and I'll share the core info if it happens again.I have tried rebooting and resetting to the original firmware but the old one is still there. How to reset the firmware from bitmain (instead of hiveos)thanks a lot for the feedback

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.created_time: February 26, 2023, 10:57:42 PMLast edit: February 26, 2023, 11:10:00 PM by BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: Miktoken* on February 26, 2023, 07:25:56 AMI have tried rebooting and resetting to the original firmware but the old one is still there. How to reset the firmware from bitmain (instead of hiveos)Have you tried to flash it through an SD card?If not yet you can follow the instruction from the link below.- Control board program recovery guideAnd then download the SD card image from the link below- https://service.bitmain.com/support/downloadclick the drop-down arrow and put it to other and then on the right click the drop-down arrow and choose flashing SD card with image.
